questions.questionText: Compare Merge Sort and Quick Sort in terms of their time complexity and use-cases.
questions.correctAnswer: Merge Sort is a stable, O(n log n) sorting algorithm best suited for linked lists and external sorting. Quick Sort is O(n log n) on average but O(n^2) worst case. It is generally faster for arrays and in-memory sorting due to locality of reference.
questions.explanation: Merge Sort divides and merges, and is more predictable in performance. Quick Sort partitions based on a pivot, and its speed comes from efficient memory use, but risks degradation on poor input order.
